items.content_html:
Summary

HTMLMediaElement.volume does not work on iOS browsers. While it returns a value and can be set, the value is always 1, and setting the value has no effect on the actual volume of the media.

I've chosen to reflect this by setting partial_implementation on the safari_ios browser along with clarifying notes.

Test results and supporting details

This app was tested on Safari iOS 11 - 15: https://0680re.csb.app/. The "Mute (Volume)" button attempts to programmatically set the volume to 0.

There isn't a lot of official documentation around this. There is a reference to this behavior in https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/AudioVideo/Conceptual/Using_HTML5_Audio_Video/Device-SpecificConsiderations/Device-SpecificConsiderations.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40009523-CH5-SW1; however, that doc is quite old, and is only concerned with Safari, even though other iOS browsers (like Chrome) also behave the same way.

This issue has been observed by others many times:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12553757/html5-ios-volumechange-event-not-fired
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/71308806/ionic-htmlaudioelement-cant-change-volume-on-ios
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59417075/javascript-detect-if-volume-can-be-set

Related issues

This was reported in #12001; however, that issue also brings up Chrome on iOS, which this PR doesn't support.

Additional Info & Questions

As mentioned above, this limitation on volume is an iOS level restriction, and applies to all browsers running on iOS, not just Safari (which is all this PR covers).

The compat data does not track, for example, Chrome on iOS (I'm curious as to the reason for this), so even if this PR were merged, the docs would still have no indication that setting volume would not work on Chrome on iOS. I'd like some input on whether I should also (in addition to this PR) open a PR in the MDN docs repo that discusses this behavior of volume on iOS more in-depth.
items.title: Change HTMLMediaElement.volume support for safari_ios to partial_implementation

items.content_html:
Summary

In FF101, the layout.css.prefers-contrast.enabled flag is set to true by default.

This PR updates the feature's browser compat data to reflect the default support from FF101.

Test results and supporting details

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1656363

Related issues

Doc issue tracking this update: mdn/content#15466
Other related doc PR: mdn/content#16109
items.title: Default support for prefers-contrast from FF101

items.content_html:
This was wrong due to testing for attributes in prototypes.

This has been in WebKit since the very beginning of the feature:
WebKit/WebKit@63f0b70

Copy the earliest versions of the parent feature. Also test
http://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/CSSKeyframesRule to
confirm support in the following browsers:

  • Chrome 15
  • IE 10
  • Opera 12.16
  • Safari 5

Part of #7755.
items.title: Update CSSKeyframesRules versions for name/cssRules

items.content_html:
This has been removed in all engines and browser releases for more than
two years. The WebKit removal isn't reflected in the data, but was here:
https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=189142

css.properties.transform-origin.three_value_syntax remains and is
different, so fix a typo in an example referring to it.

Fixes #8964.
items.title: Remove three_value_syntax features

items.content_html: As discussed in https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/pull/16281/files#r873271737
items.title: RTCDataChannel - add link to docs on what transferrable means

items.content_html: This PR removes `partial_implementation from webextensions.api.Events.event. It was added in #1686, but it seems to be due to the fact that some subfeatures weren't supported.
items.title: Remove partial_implementation from webextensions.api.Events.event

items.content_html: This PR removes the partial_implementation statements from the text-decoration CSS property for Firefox. They had come from the wiki migration with no explanation.
items.title: Remove partial_implementation statements from text-decoration

items.content_html: This PR simplifies the data for the font-size CSS property for Internet Explorer. The partial_implementation statement came from the wiki migration, but there's no explanation of why, and other rem value properties in BCD don't have a partial_implementation statement.
items.title: Simplify IE data for font-size rem values

items.content_html: This PR removes the partial_implementation statements for Safari from the font-feature-settings CSS property. In my quick manual testing, I didn't find support for this property, prefixed or unprefixed.
items.title: Remove Safari partial_implementation statements for font-feature-settings

items.content_html: This PR removes the partial_implementation: true set on the appearance CSS property. These came from the wiki migration, but I can't determine why they'd be set as such, other than the lack of support of subfeatures.
items.title: Remove "partial_implementation" from appearance property

items.content_html:
FF101 added support for RTCRtpEncodingParameters.maxFramerate, which we updated in #16200

This is supposed to be valid for a 0 value, but FF instead sets this as "no limit on frame rate". This is because the upstream libwebrtc library used will crash if a 0 value is passed (see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1611957#c10)

To fix this I have marked the API as "partial" and added a note.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#15470
items.title: RTCRtpEncodingParameters.maxFramerate - off spec zero value

items.content_html: This PR is a subset of #16051 that adds spec URLs for the HTML APIs.
items.title: Add spec URLs for HTML APIs

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects the real values for Microsoft Edge for the IdleDetector API, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v6.0.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/IdleDetector

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Update Edge versions for IdleDetector API

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects the real values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the error member of the IDBRequest API, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v6.0.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/IDBRequest/error

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Update Chromium versions for api.IDBRequest.error

items.title: Update Chromium versions for IDB APIs
